summary: This is an email chain from August 14, 2019, containing a message of support and encouragement sent to the Associate Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The context suggests it was sent during a challenging period, likely following the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the facility. The document includes a sensitive/privileged communication disclaimer from the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The recipient of a supportive email message during 'trying times' at the MCC New York facility.

events.title: Support Message to MCC NY Staff
events.description: An email message expressing thoughts, prayers, and support for the staff of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York as they face 'significant challenges moving forward'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, which was just days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
The message acknowledges 'trying times' and 'significant challenges' facing the staff of MCC New York, directly referencing the operational and reputational crisis following Epstein's death.
The document is marked as a 'SENSITIVE/PRIVILEGED COMMUNICATION' belonging to the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons.
